alert.note: Alert for Adams; Brown; Highland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 3:26PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BROWN, NORTHWESTERN ADAMS AND SOUTHWESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 326 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Georgetown, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Georgetown, Mount Orab, Winchester, Sardinia, Belfast, New Market, Emerald, Hamersville, Mowrystown, Danville in Highland County, Lake Waynoka, May Hill, Fincastle, State Route 32 at US Route 62, New Hope, State Route 136 at US Route 62 and Buford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
